Then in ExtensionBeanDefinitionRegistryPostProcessor we use said resolver?  Then we have this Front50PluginInfoReleaseProvider enabled behind a config (since we should probably roll it out as optional?).

nodes.bodyText:
In what scenario , will we see a drift between what the service is resolving(a plugin version) to and what front50 says ?
For the service, source of truth is in the config bundled and that is what gets pull down and loaded.
Day #1
Initial plugin v0.0.1 , ASG V001 -- registers with Front50 .
Day #2
Autoscale happens . config says v0.0.1 and Front50 says v0.0.1 ( everything is good )
Day #3
New commit happens in the service config and now plugin version moves to v0.0.2 , gets launched into a new ASG V002 and registers with Front50, but operator can decide to stay on v0.0.1.  Something like that..?

nodes.bodyText: I think there would be a record in front50 that operators maintain like "latest" for a service.  This way we don't automatically bump folks to the newest plugin version. This addresses the "day #3" scenario, I think.

nodes.bodyText:
Keep in mind, no service YAML config is immutable: Every config property in Spinnaker can be influenced by Fast Properties.
This is forward-compatible with a Spinnaker Admin UI which will manage what plugins are available and what version those plugins should be regardless of the latest version available or what the service config says should be loaded. Once the admin UI is available, front50 will be the SOT of what plugin version to load: Not the service config (or Fast Properties).
In today's world, you are correct, the service's config will be authoritative with front50 only being an alignment mechanism. If no version is specified in the service config, latest release is always selected.

+package com.netflix.spinnaker.kork.plugins.update.release
+
+import com.netflix.spinnaker.kork.plugins.update.ServerGroupNameResolver
+import com.netflix.spinnaker.kork.plugins.update.internal.Front50Service
+import org.pf4j.update.PluginInfo
+import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory
+
+/**
+ * Attempts to use Front50 to pin plugin versions that are loaded for a particular server group.
+ *
+ * When a service starts up, it will load local plugins, reaching out to an UpdateRepository for additional
+ * plugins to download. The service will then use [releaseProvider] to resolve the plugin versions that should be
+ * loaded. These resolved plugins are then sent to Front50 for pinning.
+ *
+ * If the server group has not been seen before, Front50 will save the service-resolved versions as the pinned versions
+ * for the server group. If the server group has been seen before, Front50 will return a corrected set of plugin
+ * versions back to the service, which it will use instead.
+ *
+ * Should any part of this process fail, the service-selected versions will be used as a fallback, making this
+ * functionality optional.
+ */
+class Front50PluginInfoReleaseProvider(
+  private val releaseProvider: PluginInfoReleaseProvider,
+  private val front50Service: Front50Service,
+  private val serverGroupNameResolver: ServerGroupNameResolver,
+  private val serviceName: String
+) : PluginInfoReleaseProvider {
+
+  private val log by lazy { LoggerFactory.getLogger(javaClass) }
+
+  override fun getReleases(pluginInfo: List<PluginInfo>): Set<PluginInfoRelease> {
+    val resolvedPlugins = releaseProvider.getReleases(pluginInfo)
+
+    val serverGroupName = serverGroupNameResolver.get()
+    if (serverGroupName == null) {
+      log.warn("Could not resolve my server group name: Plugin versioning is disabled")
+      return resolvedPlugins
+    }
+
+    val response = front50Service.pinVersions(
+      serviceName,
+      serverGroupName,
+      resolvedPlugins.toPinnedVersions()
+    ).execute()
+
+    if (!response.isSuccessful) {
+      log.error(
+        "Failed pinning plugin versions, falling back to locally-sourced plugin versions: {}",
+        response.message()
+      )
+      return resolvedPlugins
+    }
+
+    response.body()?.updateReleases(resolvedPlugins)
+
+    return resolvedPlugins
+  }
+
+  private fun Set<PluginInfoRelease>.toPinnedVersions(): PinnedVersions =
+    PinnedVersions(map { it.pluginId to it.props.version }.toMap())
+
+  private fun PinnedVersions.updateReleases(pluginInfoReleases: Set<PluginInfoRelease>) {
+    pluginInfoReleases.forEach {
+      pluginVersions[it.pluginId]?.let { version ->
+        if (it.props.version != version) {
+          log.info("Aligning plugin '${it.pluginId}' to pinned version: ${it.props.version} -> $version")

nodes.bodyText: We will probably want to disable this PluginInfoReleaseProvider until the front50 side is in place.

Hm.  Just realized we'll need to change props to a var in PluginInfoRelease.  Front50 will also need to return the PF4J PluginInfo.Release object here.  We can't simply swap out the version, because just the version field will change but we'll still end up downloading the artifact set in the url field.

+ * for the server group. If the server group has been seen before, Front50 will return a corrected set of plugin
+ * versions back to the service, which it will use instead.
+ *
+ * Should any part of this process fail, the service-selected versions will be used as a fallback, making this
+ * functionality optional.
+ */
+class Front50PluginInfoReleaseProvider(
+  private val releaseProvider: PluginInfoReleaseProvider,
+  private val front50Service: Front50Service,
+  private val serverGroupNameResolver: ServerGroupNameResolver,
+  private val serverGroupLocationResolver: ServerGroupLocationResolver,
+  private val serviceName: String

+
+  private val log by lazy { LoggerFactory.getLogger(javaClass) }

+  override fun getReleases(pluginInfo: List<PluginInfo>): Set<PluginInfoRelease> {

+    val serverGroupName = serverGroupNameResolver.get()

+      log.warn("Could not resolve server group name: Skipping front50 plugin version resolution")
+      return resolvedPlugins
+    }

+
+    return resolvedPlugins

+package com.netflix.spinnaker.kork.plugins.update.release
+
+import com.netflix.spinnaker.kork.plugins.update.ServerGroupLocationResolver
+import com.netflix.spinnaker.kork.plugins.update.ServerGroupNameResolver
+import com.netflix.spinnaker.kork.plugins.update.internal.Front50Service
+import org.pf4j.update.PluginInfo
+import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory
+
+/**
+ * Attempts to use Front50 to pin plugin versions that are loaded for a particular server group.
+ *
+ * When a service starts up, it will load local plugins, reaching out to an UpdateRepository for additional
+ * plugins to download. The service will then use [releaseProvider] to resolve the plugin versions that should be
+ * loaded. These resolved plugins are then sent to Front50 for pinning.
+ *
+ * If the server group has not been seen before, Front50 will save the service-resolved versions as the pinned versions
+ * for the server group. If the server group has been seen before, Front50 will return a corrected set of plugin
+ * versions back to the service, which it will use instead.
+ *
+ * Should any part of this process fail, the service-selected versions will be used as a fallback, making this
+ * functionality optional.
+ */
+class Front50PluginInfoReleaseProvider(
+  private val releaseProvider: PluginInfoReleaseProvider,
+  private val front50Service: Front50Service,
+  private val serverGroupNameResolver: ServerGroupNameResolver,
+  private val serverGroupLocationResolver: ServerGroupLocationResolver,
+  private val serviceName: String
+) : PluginInfoReleaseProvider {
+
+  private val log by lazy { LoggerFactory.getLogger(javaClass) }
+
+  override fun getReleases(pluginInfo: List<PluginInfo>): Set<PluginInfoRelease> {
+    val resolvedPlugins = releaseProvider.getReleases(pluginInfo)
+
+    val serverGroupName = serverGroupNameResolver.get()
+    if (serverGroupName == null) {
+      log.warn("Could not resolve server group name: Skipping front50 plugin version resolution")
+      return resolvedPlugins
+    }
+    val serverGroupLocation = serverGroupLocationResolver.get()
+    if (serverGroupLocation == null) {
+      log.warn("Could not resolve server group location: Skipping front50 plugin version resolution")
+      return resolvedPlugins
+    }
+
+    val response = front50Service.pinVersions(
+      serviceName,
+      serverGroupLocation,
+      serverGroupName,
+      resolvedPlugins.toPinnedVersions()
+    ).execute()
+
+    if (!response.isSuccessful) {
+      log.error(
+        "Failed pinning plugin versions in front50, falling back to locally-sourced plugin versions: {}",
+        response.message()
+      )
+      return resolvedPlugins
+    }
+
+    response.body()?.updateReleases(resolvedPlugins)
+
+    return resolvedPlugins
+  }
+
+  private fun Set<PluginInfoRelease>.toPinnedVersions(): PinnedVersions =
+    PinnedVersions(map { it.pluginId to it.props.version }.toMap())
+
+  private fun PinnedVersions.updateReleases(pluginInfoReleases: Set<PluginInfoRelease>) {
+    pluginInfoReleases.forEach {
+      pluginVersions[it.pluginId]?.let { version ->
+        if (it.props.version != version) {
+          log.info("Aligning plugin '${it.pluginId}' to pinned version: ${it.props.version} -> $version")
+          it.props.version = version
